description: Number of derangements of n where minimal cycle size is 4.
references: H. S. Wilf, Generatingfunctionology, Academic Press, NY, 1990, p. 147, Eq. 5.2.9 (q=3).
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
H. S. Wilf, Generatingfunctionology, 2nd edn., Academic Press, NY, 1994, p. 176, Eq. 5.2.9 (q=3).
formula: a(n) = (n-1)*a(n-1) + (n-1)*(n-2)*(n-3)*a(n-4).E.g.f.: A(x) = 1/(1-x)*exp(-x-x^2/2-x^3/3) = 1 + 6*x^4/4! + 24*x^5/5! + ... satisfies the differential equation A'(x) = x^3/(1-x)*A(x). - _Peter Bala_, Apr 18 2012a(n) ~ n! * exp(-11/6). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 13 2013
maple: with(combstruct): ZL3:=[S,{S=Set(Cycle(Z,card>3))},labeled] :seq (count (ZL3, size=n), n=0..21); # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Sep 26 2007
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
